page.title: 10WESTBURY MAJORETTES
page.content: Westbury Majorettes are a group of girls who march/dance to music. They travel to other towns to perform in carnivals, competitions and other social gatherings. The younger girls are in the Junior Troupe. They practice every Monday in the Youth Centre. The older girls are in the Senior Troupe and they practice in the Paragon Hall. The mimimum age for membership is 6; promotion to the Senior Troupe is a combination of merit and age. The uniform consists of a green tunic, hat and sash. The girls carry a baton which is thrown and twirled during the routines. Merit and service badges are worn on the sash. The Majorettes travel to events in their own bus the furthest trip in recent months was to Cardiff but more usually they visit local towns in Wiltshire and Somerset.
